front.title: Media Policy Manipulation in the Conference Policy Control Protocol

abstract.t: The SIP conferencing framework defines a model for tightly-coupledconferencing in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), in which aConference Policy Control Protocol is used to manipulate policiesrelevant to a specific conference, such as conference membershippolicy, authorization policy, and media policy. This documentdescribes a logical model to describe media processing in a SIPconference. It also defines specific protocol semantics and aspecific syntax to manipulate that model.
